page.title: 03RUDDINGTON FRAMEWORK COMPLEX
page.content: This museum is on {CHAPEL STREET}and is a row of cottages and the framework shops. {William Lee}invented the hand frame in {1589}and by Victorian times {RUDDINGTON}was a centre for{FRAMEWORK {KNITTING.} They were a poor community who lived in cramped cottages often with three to a bed and worked long hours and even the children were seamers and winders.The boys had to light the fire early in the morning to warm the machines so the factory was very stuffy. The cottages are furnished as they would have been in{1850.} Nowadays when the museum is open you can see {Peta Lewis}using the heavy machines and {Audrey Turner} using the stocking knitting machine. The socks and scarves can be bought in the shop.
